newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Mahathir wants higher savings from Malaysians.
newsitem.headline: Mahathir wants higher savings from Malaysians.

text.p: Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Monday he wanted Malaysians to achieve a much higher national savings rate than the current 38.8 percent.
"We want to reach 45 percent," Mahathir said. "Thirty-eight percent, according to most authorities in the world, is fantastic. But we want to be more fantastic."
Mahathir, speaking after launching a national savings campaign, said he was confident the country could reach the target as many Malaysians still did not plan their savings activities.
In an earlier speech on the same campaign, central bank governor Ahmad Mohamed Don estimated the 1996 national savings rate at 38.8 percent against 36.5 percent the previous year.
But Ahmad said the high savings rate was still below the nation's 1996 investment rate of 45.1 percent.
"To reduce the gap, the savings rate which we have achieved will have to be raised further," Ahmad said.
He said to encourage Malaysians to save, new financial products and efficient mechanisms to attract savings will be introduced. He did not elaborate.
